instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not charge battery
threads.message:
The main problem was the system that did not start, giving a critical update error.

There was a lot of oxidation near the <CHIP>U4200</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3500</CHIP>. I replaced all the components (resistors and capacitor).

It worked well for 2 days, but now it doesn't charge the battery (Mac recognizes the charger) and the ports on the left don't work with accessories (pendrive, HD).

I checked everything near the <CHIP>U3500</CHIP> and I don't have 5v on the L3500 with accessories connected.

Some help?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not charge battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not charge battery
threads.message:
It's not correct!
VVC - 5v
EN - 0

I checked the EN line in diode mode and got 0.540.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not charge battery
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3500</CHIP> gets enable signal from <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200.
Compare diode mode readings on J3300 and JB500 pins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not charge battery
threads.message:
I discovered a resistor (<RESISTOR>R3517</RESISTOR>) with a soldering problem. I decided to soldier him again.

Thanks a lot for the help.
